column5: Tbh i think Iâ€™d prefer the poetry to stay the same lol

Depression. Itâ€™s such a tease. You get these highs. It comes back with ease. 

You wake up everyday. You beg and you beg. Let today be the day. I turn my life around please. 

As the money gets lower. The debts get higher. The oxygen runs out. And so does the fire. 

Youâ€™re left there. Thinking of all the moments you wish you could fix. The rooms silent. The clock ticks. There you go again. Wishing you had super powers. I mean you day dream about the shit for hours and hours. 

Truth is. I canâ€™t fix the past. Itâ€™ll never get better. These highs theyâ€™re light like a feather but these lows could rip leather and this life is the worst weather itâ€™s cold and warm never I just. Want. To be. Better. 

Itâ€™s hard not to feel like I have a curse. It gets better. And immediately worse. Than ever before. I mean honestly. In my heart. In my mind. I know where happiness I find. Itâ€™s me. Who makes me blind. I know exactly how to ease my mind. Some need meds. Some need someone to call. I. Just need to end it all. 

But tomorrow Iâ€™ll wake up and continue with this disease. Because depression is such a tease.  Hereâ€™s a comment with the poem for those who canâ€™t see.

Same lowkey. Donâ€™t know when Iâ€™ll hit a big enough low to do it. But I know in my heart Iâ€™ll do it at some point. Its not just the depression. Itâ€™s not just how my life has gone up to this point. Thatâ€™s all shit too. Itâ€™s about the fact that I genuinely donâ€™t enjoy life or society. Iâ€™ve always been outcasted. Always been done wrong by anyone whoâ€™s ever came into my life. Only time I was ever liked was when I was on drugs and hitting licks on fucks. Iâ€™m not meant to live a good life. So when it comes time. Thatâ€™s how Iâ€™ll go.

This idea that weâ€™ve had our whole lives thatâ€™s been instilled is that life will magically get better. And stay better. And that in itself helps drive depression. Because we get a few days where we feel okay. And the low hits. Something happens. And there ya go. Weeks of feeling like your life is just a waste.
